You are not running the test suite here that was blocking Bug 52627 - use 
UiTestSuite for that.

I assume you selected the project and just ran as JUnit plug-in test?

Also, can the particular test that fails 
(org.eclipse.ui.tests.api.Bug42616Test 
org.eclipse.ui.tests.dialogs.UIMessageDialogs ) be run on it's own?

I am wondering if we are running out of resources or if this test is the 
problem

ok, i ran UiTestSuite class specifically and wasn't expected to interact with the test.
and i am running as a junit plugin test.

i didn't see the error around test 135, but now i'm frozen on test 266/357. the last line in my console is 
testEditPage: tearDown...

ok it might be resources? i tried with -Xmx512M -Xms256M and got to 268/357. on another (my most 
recent) run i got also to 353/357.

The problem appears to be in Junit rather than a problem with resources. When I run 
IWorkbenchPageTest the editor tests fail. 

Around test 15 of 30 it just stops with a window that says "a null and void" I am not sure if 
this is a Mac window or not.

Moving to EditorMgmt to solve the failing test case but I think the JUnit support in general 
is problematic on the mac.

The test suites are terminating without an error to the console or the log on shutdown of a 
suite that opens an editor. The APITestSuite is the easiest way to replace this.

I am aware of the problems reported in comment #6. I am currently in the process
of modifying the suites to run correctly on Mac OS X.

I have entered a new bug report (69892) to investigate the UI test suites on Mac
OS X.

Marking this bug as a duplicate of 69892.
